subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: The Chinese Football Association announced that its chairman, Xie Yalong, was taking a leave to attend government management school. The move came in the face of widespread criticism of Xie, who is often blamed by fans for the dismal performance of the Chinese men’s national and Olympic teams. On its Web site, the association on Wednesday said Nan Yong, the vice chairman and the association’s Communist Party secretary, would take Xie’s place while he was away.
